newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran relaunches train to Azeri enclave Nakhichevan.
newsitem.headline: Iran relaunches train to Azeri enclave Nakhichevan.

text.p: Iran has relaunched train services to Azerbaijan's enclave of Nakhichevan after a disruption of about nine years, a newspaper said on Tuesday.

The daily Jomhuri Eslami said the once-weekly service was restarted on Sunday with a passenger train leaving Tabriz in northwestern Iran to neighbouring Nakhichevan and another train running in the opposite direction.
The service was halted in 1988 due to the conflict in the region between Azerbaijan and Armenia over the enclave of Nagorno-Karabakh, it said.
The Iranian news agency IRNA said the trains would carry passengers and cargo.
Nakhichevan, sandwiched between Iran and Armenia, relies on the Islamic republic for much of its electricity and food supplies because of a blockade imposed by Armenia.
